Sorry:

Still working on the photos.  Real world keeps getting in the way!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Barry Thomas 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, March 06, 2005 3:17 AM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Recent acquisition baffles me


  I haven't seen any pictures up yet (have I missed something??).

  Once upon a time I saw a kowakizashi saya that looked like it was "made of
  bamboo".  It was, in fact, one of the most skillfully executed lacquer works I
  have ever seen.  No doubt about it - real urushi.  It had leaves and minute ants
  also in lacquer - oh, and signed as well.  It left me gobsmacked.  This was
  really, really top class work.  Way beyond my pocket...


  Barry Thomas.

  ----- Original Message -----
  From: grandone0 <grandone@...>
  To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
  Sent: Friday, March 04, 2005 5:04 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Recent acquisition baffles me


  I recently acquired a katana that the seller swears is Japanese.  He
  says it is 130 to 140 yeears old.  I've never seen one like it
  before. It's saya is made of bamboo...
